Reviews.Title: “great hotel on the water that won't break your budget”
Reviews.Author: IntrepidFromDC
Reviews.Content: Talbot Inn is close to the rides and a few very good restaurants (and just across the bridge from our favorite restaurant in OC, Shark On The Harbor). As you can see from the photo attached, it is newer construction by Ocean City standards, but the price point, for the fantastic location, is very affordable. The rooms are clean, beds are comfortable, the tv is LCD HD. Rooms have fridge, microwave, hairdryer, coffee maker and the little conditioner bottles. Kids did not get black feet from walking barefoot on the carpeting, which was comfy and newish. It's a ten minute walk to rides, games, boardwalk and the widest part of Ocean City's very clean beach. Excursions leave from the dock right outside the hotel. The sunset photo attached was taken from our hotel balcony 8/8/2012. The reasons I can't give Talbot Inn five-out-of-five: 1. There is not enough parking. If you are lucky to get a parking space the walk to the rooms is very short, but otherwise you have to let their (free) valet park your car for you, and they keep the key until you need it or they can find a spot. 2. There was a hole in the bathroom ceiling right over the shower. A big hole. about eight inches by twelve inches, we could see the insulation and rafters. 3. The smoke detector was hanging from the ceiling by the wires, as if it went off and someone hit it with a broom. How can they not fix this before check-in? 4. No daily changes of bedsheets. All in all, we were very pleased with our stay and will be back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome time”
Reviews.Author: Cheryl I
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband will be the word of mouth spokes person for the talbort inn in ocean city maryland . The room was all of it, it was clean , neat, very confortalbe and the clerk that took my resveration was also awesome is name was TRIPP, he was cool, right on point with all information, very knowledgeable about the area and the history of O.C. I am telling all my friends where to stay. TALBOT INN. I love the kitchen it was just right not to big, not to small just enough dishes. I HAD A BALL. Will return back soon

Reviews.Title: “Talbot Inn a fantastic place to book!”
Reviews.Author: Bob D
Reviews.Content: First off it is an almost perfect location! You are located right on an inlet bay with beautiful views and sceneary! Especially bayside offers terrific views but if you stay street side all you have to do is turn your head to see more amazing views. You are only a few minute walk away from the famous Ocean City beaches and right there at the Talbot Inn during your stay offers you plenty of activities to choose from. You can deep sea fish, bay fish, or go on many of their wonderful cruises. They have a bar and grille with great entertainment and food right on location and if you have more of a family-oriented vacation they also tailor some of the boat rides for kids specifically! The customer service is great...anything from speaking to the managers, to the fron desk employees, to housekeeping who does great at cleaning and refreshing rooms as preferred! Even the prices are reasonable! I would reccomend the Talbot Inn as a stay for anybody or any family!

Reviews.Title: “Needs to change with the times”
Reviews.Author: Michael d
Reviews.Content: Stayed at talbot inn for first time on cruise in weekend in oct 2011. Was a little worried that they didn't have updated credit card equipment. Rightfully so. This was the only time that year I used this card and the next day after checking out my card number was used on a dating website. Visa caught it right away and froze account because I was married and 50 years old. Will never return. If you stay here check your credit card bills closely.

Reviews.Title: “Basic clean room, close to board walk at a reasonable rate”
Reviews.Author: kaasfamily4
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Talbot and my husband has stayed there a number of times with the boys when they go to OC on fishing trips. It definitely is conveniently close to the board walk, just a couple of blocks of a walk. We have stayed on the street side and have never noticed any noise from the bar on the bay side. Free parking was great.

Reviews.Title: “BED BUGS”
Reviews.Author: arc4mdm
Reviews.Content: My family arrived at the talbot inn and i check the bed first thing. I found bed bugs under the covers. I told management and they moved us rooms. the next day that room was occupied. a day later after room service left my parents room my mom found bed bugs in her beds. They also moved rooms. By the next morning that room was occupied. No professional bug people ever looked at these rooms. Time to find a new place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “waste of money”
Reviews.Author: brooklyn_06
Reviews.Content: we stayed for the week of my birthday and were defiantely diappointed when we arrived. the website says fully equipped kitchen, but their is no oven. the fridge is old and rust, only 1 burner worked on the stove, and the rooms were small and nasty (not to metion the gross bathroom) this is the worst place i have stayed in oc. if anyone visits west virginia i would highly recommend harmans nort fork cottage, llc located in petersburg (cabins) wv. they are quiet and very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Safe Fun and Family”
Reviews.Author: jendeues
Reviews.Content: I love Ocean City and I love Talbot. We always stay here. We have the handicapped room, two other rooms and both apartments. The handicapped room is awesome it is the best, the ramp the bathroom and the locations. Everything is handicapped friendly. The motel has noise from the upper floors if you are a light sleeper stay on the 3rd floor and you have the view. All and any horseplay that is not fit is stopped and removed from the area. The apartments same way if you have both put the light walkers on the top. We bought a grill and grilled out, we love the kitchens and frdges, the food is wonderful at MR DUCKSs and the staff are awesome from owner, manager, recepionist etc. Gary is my favorite he is awesome. I wish we could bring the dogs and make a extra deposit some places are allowing this we are working on it. Atleast for the apartment. The atmosphere is pleasant and the bands are a blast, not annoying and the bar is quiet for the most part. I love it, it is clean have an issue and they take care of you. If you are a light sleeper and the bar is there, there is not a quarantee when the people leave and if someone might have a loud laugh so ask for a room on the other side of it, you gotta think to know what you are getting into all they can do is tell you the usual. I will be back again and again as long as I am able.

Reviews.Title: “great place for the money”
Reviews.Author: rivertown
Reviews.Content: one of the best places ive stayed in oc for the oct car show. price was right and mr ducks is the place. rooms are greAT . no problem parking of course I use public transportation alot....;the placr is great and the staff is too

Reviews.Title: “Definetly worth it!”
Reviews.Author: JULIE2104
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went for Labor Day weekend to do some fishing, relaxing and to have a good time. I was a bit skeptical since some of the reviews indicated a few issues such as parking, loud music and not being able to sleep but I am here to confirm different. We arrived on Friday evening at peak time when the band was playing and the place was packed but had no problem finding a parking spot write in front. The band was good and stopped playing at a reasonable hour. We had a bay view room on the 2nd floor overlooking a part of the festivities, along with our own balcony which offered a great view and had no problem sleeping. Room was average but clean and came equiped with a very small kitchonette including pots/pans which came in handy and saved on additional added expenses. Location is great if your looking to do some fishing since basically everything is write there or within walking distance - M.R. Ducks (Bar/Grille) has good burgers along with their gift shop write on premises. One thing I would have to say is we did get a great parking spot but since there was alot of activiites going on which brought in the crowds, valet parked the vehicles in the parking lot and blocked our vehicle in which did not bring any problems to us since everything was within parking distance but if we had to use our vehicle there may have been a problem. Considering all of this along with the great room rate, it's worth it and will definitely be coming back. Hope this review helps.

Reviews.Title: “Parking”
Reviews.Author: IamSugarBear
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at theTalbot Inn, three times this summer. Our stays at The Talbot Inn was great , service was awesome, rooms are nice and clean, But had serveral problems with parking again . we are giving a parking permit for the entire time of our stay. when there were bands playing at MR Ducks, we were told there was no parking , parking lot was full , due to customers coming in for the bands. I feel that we are being just pushed aside, after they aready had our monies. We paid for our reservations, the customers for the Talbot Inn should come first, not customers to come see the bands.

Reviews.Title: “Sleepless in OC”
Reviews.Author: vvg
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a place to stay and while going to have a drink at M.R. Ducks we saw there was an inn right there. We asked to view the room and the desk staff seemed surprised that we asked to. We found the room clean but very basic, which was fine. The room was bayside which was nice as it looked over the marina, however it was directly above the bar - M.R. Ducks which happened to have a band and we could hear everything in the room. We went back to desk and said thanks but no, and told them we thought the room would be much too loud considering it was right over the bar, but they assured us that the band would end at 8pm and when we asked what time the bar closed, we were told it quieted down fairly early - maybe 10pm. That was fine with us as we were planning on going out for some drinks ourselves and wouldn't be bothered by the bar's activities. Yes the band did stop, but the bar stayed open until the wee hours. We could hear everything including the bar music plus a couple of fights between people. We would fall asleep and then wake up to loud laughing, or fighting...this went on until 2:40 am. It was the most restless night. Aside from that, the room was clean, but again basic. No shampoo, no hair dryer, towels were small, blankets had burn holes in them and the sheets were old, but clean, typical poly bed covers. Room had a small fridge, microwave and two burners for cooking. I never looked to see if there were pots or plates. Location was fairly good as it was a few blocks from the boardwalk and activities. I don't think that we'll stay again as we like our sleep and we felt we were lied to about the noise. I could see this as a good spot for those wanting to go fishing as its next to the marina, but its not a relaxing place at all. If you decide to go - ask for a room that is not bayside.

Reviews.Title: “Talbot Inn--not again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed for several days at the Talbot Inn in Ocean City, Maryland on the recommendations I read on the Trip Advisor website. Nearly all the comments were positive. I would like to add my observations on the motel. Those who had stayed there before me apparently had very low expectations of the facility—or the service had deteriorated by the time I arrived. To be fair to the establishment, the room was very clean and the air conditioning and TV worked fine. The room was Spartan—no pictures on the walls, no tissues, an ice bucket but no ice machine, soap but no shampoo, coffee-maker but no coffee. It was a very hot day, but their soda machine was out of bottled water. The door stuck so badly that I had to force it with my shoulder to get into the room. After we arrived, we went downstairs to M.R. Ducks, owned by the same people who own the Talbot Inn. There was no hostess around and it appeared that no one was in charge. After waiting for a hostess to show up, we seated ourselves—and were completely ignored by the wait staff for fifteen minutes. So we left and went next door to the Angler Restaurant for dinner (which, by the way, was excellent—and friendly). On the second day we discovered that the food we had put in the refrigerator was still warm. The refrigerator did not work. I called down to the desk and the attendant told me “OK.” I assumed that meant that he would send someone up to check it. He didn’t. I went down to the office and asked for some ice. They informed me that it would $1.50 for the ice. After I paid $130.00 a night for a room with a broken refrigerator, they wanted $1.50 for ice to keep my food from spoiling. When we checked out, I informed them that the refrigerator was broken and no one checked, even though I called. The clerk looked under the desk and told me “No one wrote it down.” He didn’t apologize; he didn’t offer to adjust the bill. He didn’t even ask how the room was or how our stay was. He simply looked at my signed credit card slip and said, “OK, you can go.” A restaurant or lodging facility should offer more than a used bed or a hot meal (although I never got the chance to see if the food really was hot). Patrons have the right to expect courteous efficient attention from those places where they choose to spend their money. They shouldn’t have to tolerate rude and sloppy service. On another day the Talbot Inn and M.R. Ducks may be fine places to sleep and eat. Unfortunately it was not on the days when I was there, and most likely, I will choose someplace else if I return to Ocean City.

Reviews.Title: “Good Deal for the Price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My mom and I stayed here for a quick getaway to OC. The location was great, it was quiet at night and only about 2 blocks from the beach. The MR Ducks bar outside was close and convenient for a few drinks at night. The room was not luxurious, but it was only 120 a night, which at the time of booking was quite a bargain compared to some of the other dumps in town. The room was as clean as could be expected from a hotel like this one, I certainly wasnt offended. I do not recommend dining at the Marina Deck restaurant however. We had lunch and breakfast there and didnt have a good experience either time.

Reviews.Title: “great time at the talbot”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: i love the talbot inn it's in a great location, the rooms are clean and the right size for me and my boy friend, the staff is friendly, i stay there every spring and fall i have a great time, AAAA+

Reviews.Title: “Affordable, great location and Nice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We looked for a place at the last minute and we were able to get a room at the Talbot Inn Monday-Friday for our second week in August vacation. I was surprised at the amount they charge per night compared to some other motels we have stayed at in Ocean City. We booked it from doing searches on the internet so I was somewhat scared of what we may find. As far a price, it was the lowest we found anywhere in Ocean City based on the availability we needed. The room was bigger than I had anticipated and the kitchen was just the right size for the two of us. The room was bright, clean, up to date and the staff was very friendly. The girl who cleaned our room each day was friendly and did an excellent job. I loved the location of the Talbot Inn. We never had to move our car. We walked everywhere. We had a great vacation and I would stay at the Talbot Inn again!

Reviews.Title: “Love the Talbot Inn”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Talbot Inn several years in a row. They are ALWAYS the first place I call for a room. The rooms are clean and the staff is very friendly. The first time I made a reservation with them I was unsure if I wanted bayside or streetside. They were very honest with me and said that streetside was much quieter, especially on the weekends when the bands are at MR Ducks. This year we had a very large party, so we rented a house instead. If you stay at the Talbot Inn don't miss out eating right next door at the Marina Deck. The food is excellent, a little expensive, but excellent.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay for the 4th of July!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in one of the rooms on the bayside for the weekend of the 4th..What a great place to stay, the fireworks were right in front of the Inn on the beach side, we didn't have to leave the Inn and deal with all crowds at the inlet ...the rooms are nice size with a kitchenette, you can sit on the balcony and watch the boats right in front of you, (Not to mention all of the excitement at M.R.Ducks right outside your balcony door)..Everything you need and want to do is within walking distance.. T.W Baltimore, Md

Reviews.Title: “a little bit of heaven”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week at the Talbot Inn. The view from a bayside room is just beautiful. You don't want to leave your room. It got a little noisy at night from the M.R. Ducks outdoor bar and there are no elevators to the second and third floors{ They should tell you this when you call}, BUT the room and view and perfect location make it worth it. WE loved it and would go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Talbot Inn”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Inn at the end of August 2003. This was my first trip to ocean city and I thought that the rooms were great and very clean. What I also liked about the location was that it was 2 blocks away from the boardwalk so when we wanted to wind-down we didn't hear a lot of noise coming from other visitors. We are planning our next trip for July 2004. We have 5 children together and this inn will accomodate all of us and at an affordable price! I recommend this Inn to anyone who would like to save a little money without sacrific quality and comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed there in October 2003 for the weekend. We went for a spur of the moment getaway and had no advance reservations. During this time, Ocean City is less crowded and we had no trouble getting a room at the Talbot Inn. The desk staff was very accomodating when we asked for a specific room (end unit on the top floor). You can't beat the location of this hotel, as it is situated near the inlet where a lot of the fishing boats come in (beautiful sunsets as well). The room was very clean and reasonably priced. The only drawback is they have no king size beds and the mattresses are very hard. My boyfriend joked it was like sleeping on a park bench. Overall though, we had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel at a Reasonable Price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Talbot in twice. The first time I was there was in 2000. I was pleasantly surprized by the size of the rooms and how clean they were. It was not at all a typical beach hotel. Every room had a small kitchen and an living area separate from the beds. The prices were unbeleivably cheap compared to some of the other hotels I priced. The one downfall to this hotel is the walk to the beach. The hotel is right on the bay on Talbot street so you have about a 4 block walk to the beach plus you have to cross Baltimore Avenue. The next years my friends and I returned to this hotel and returned a two bedroom apartment they were offering for $800.00 a week. The outside of this place does not do it justice. It was beatiful inside, completely remolded. There was a large screened in porch on the front with a beatifull bay breeze. i would recommend the Talbot to anyone looking for great accomodations at a reasonable price.

HotelInfo.Name: Talbot Inn
HotelInfo.Address: Talbot Street and the Bay, Talbot Street Pier, Ocean City, MD 21843
